verbose_text: To determine whether TFAP2C binds to the KE, we carried out ChIP-qPCR with anti-TFAP2C antibodies using day 4 aggregates generated from the H1 hESC line and discovered that TFAP2C binds to the KE (XREF_FIG), thus suggesting that TFAP2C may act in part to regulate the expression of KLF4 during aggregate differentiation.
